content.text: How do I improve my break shot?

Let's approach this systematically. The ideal break shot contact point is 1/8th tip above center on the cue ball, striking the head ball at its center mass. Start with the cue ball behind the head string, slightly right of center. I'd recommend practicing with just the rack, focusing on accuracy before power.
What's the best way to handle rail shots?

Rail shots require precise contact points. First, identify your ghost ball position - that's where the cue ball needs to contact the object ball. For rail shots, reduce your power to about 60% and focus on a level cue stick. Would you like me to explain the 30Â° rule for rail shots?
